constraints: Completeness ("full"): The response provides a thorough answer for normal use, covering all major aspects without needing every micro-detail.
Scope ("struct"): The response focuses on how things are arranged or related—dependencies, coordination, constraints, incentives, or organizing patterns.
Method ("effects"): The response traces second- and third-order effects and summarises their downstream consequences.
